content:
innovative choreography will interface with text video and creative costuming on Friday and Saturday when graduate dance student Corrie Cowart presents her masters of fine arts concert Connections. both performances will take place at  p.m PERIOD in the M PERIOD Frances Dougherty Dance Theatre at Gerlinger Annex PERIOD

The student dancers have been rehearsing since fall and Cowart said the concert consists of six pieces some of which were years in the making PERIOD The selections include Thimbleberry Sketches a dance video Cowart directed in the Columbia River Gorge PERIOD The footage includes performers exploring movement in waterfalls on cliff edges and in fields PERIOD

Its filmed in the place where I grew up so its kind of nostalgic to me Cowart said PERIOD

Cowart will also perform in two duets with husband and fellow graduate student Tim Cowart including Embrace a work created by Seattle choreographer Wade Madsen PERIOD

What She Said Wardrobe Wars and a solo created for Tim Cowart are also part of the program  each displaying Corrie Cowarts original choreography PERIOD

In addition to Corrie Cowarts and Madsens works dancers in Eugene choreographer Alito Alessis humorous Hoop Dance will cavort and fly across the stage PERIOD

Im a pretty playful person Corrie Cowart said PERIOD So overall theres a pretty playful sense about the concert. tickets are  general admission and  for students and senior citizens and are available at the door  minutes prior to the performance PERIOD

 Jacquelyn Lewis

The Daily Emerald is the news division of Emerald Media Group University of Oregons independent student media organization PERIOD
